thread.title: More work to be done on economy, UK finance minister tells cabinet

title: More work to be done on economy, UK finance minister tells cabinet
text: March 13, 2018 / 12:41 PM / a minute ago More work to be done on economy, UK finance minister tells cabinet Reuters Staff 1 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - Finance minister Philip Hammond told top ministers on Tuesday there was still work to be done on the British economy and that he would continue to take a balanced approach to its management, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said. Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond leaves 11 Downing Street to deliver his half-yearly update on the public finances, in London, March 13, 2018. REUTERS/Toby Melville “He said there is still work to be done but the government will always take a balanced approach to reduce our debt, invest in public services and keep taxes low,” her spokesman told reporters. Reporting by William James, editing by Elizabeth Piper
